page.title: 15The Crown Inn, Everleigh
page.content: Formerly the Dower House, the Crown Inn was converted to its present use in 1790. During its life span it has played host to all manner of sporting persuits including Falconry, Hare Coarsing, the Tedworth Fox Hounds, and angling on the R.Avon which runs through the grounds. Standing at the original crossroads between Salisbury and Marlborough, the Crown served an important role a coach house. The Crown was used as a Court House by Circuit Judges, one of whom was "Hanging" Judge Jefferies. The first case in which finger print evidence was used was tried here. In present times the Crown is the meeting place for village activities, i.e. Polling Station and Parish Council meetings,etc.
